thread.title: Roy Hodgson considering Norwich job as former England boss eyes return to management in the Championship

title: Roy Hodgson considering Norwich job as former England boss eyes return to management in the Championship

text:
Roy Hodgson considering Norwich job as former England boss eyes return to management in the Championship 
Canaries are looking for a new boss after firing Alex Neil Gossip Comments ROY HODGSON is reportedly in the frame to become Norwich’s new manager. 
According to the Mirror , the former England chief is prepared to work in the Championship as he seeks a route back into football. Reuters 6 Roy Hodgson in considering a return to management with Norwich 
Hodgson has not managed since stepping down as England boss following the Three Lions’ humiliating Euro 2016 exit at the hands of Iceland. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Sun Football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But he is now thought to be considering taking the reins at Carrow Road, where he would work for family friend Delia Smith . 
Alan Pardew is the bookies’ favourite, with Mark Warburton also in the running – although the former Brentford and Rangers boss is expected to take over at Nottingham Forest this week. AP:Associated Press Roy Hodgson has not managed since England were knocked out of Euro 2016 by Iceland Reuters 6 Hodgson is a family friend of Delia Smith, who is the club’s joint majority shareholder along with her husband Michael Wynn Jones (centre) 
The Canaries are in the market for a new boss having axed Alex Neil with the club’s chances of bouncing back to the Premier League in tatters. 
They have won just one of their last eight Championship matches and now sit 12 points back from the play-off spots with nine games left. Getty Images Former Crystal Palace boss Alan Pardew is thought to be in the running for the Norwich job News Group Newspapers Ltd Former Rangers chief Mark Warburton could also take over, but Nottingham Forest is seen as a more likely destination MOST READ IN SPORT CAN'T KEEP CALM AND CARRA ON Hilarious moment Jamie Carragher snaps at Jamie Redknapp for interrupting his expert analysis on Sky Sports Team News Chelsea vs Manchester United team news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic ruled out of key FA Cup clash through suspension Red Mist Marcos Rojo facing retrospective FA ban after appearing to stamp on Chelsea's Eden Hazard during FA Cup clash at Stamford Bridge 2 Ron Rons Cristiano Ronaldo 'to be dad of twins' as surrogate mother revealed to be expecting 'very soon' CLASH FOR RASH Marcus Rashford IS with the Manchester United squad... but remains a doubt for Chelsea FA Cup tie HOOVER THE MOON Lincoln CLEANED UP the Emirates dressing room after making history with run to the FA Cup quarter-final 
Neil, 32, told talkSPORT : “It’s a strange feeling but all good things come to an end, and unfortunately that’s what happened with Norwich. 
“The play-offs were going to be difficult with the league position we found ourselves in, but I was still hopeful we could put a run of results together. PA:Press Association 6 Alex Neil was axed as Norwich chief with the club out of contention for promotion 
“I felt I had a lot of fight left in me to see this season through and go on and hopefully try and improve and get us up the table. But, these things happen in football. 
“I’ve got no grievances and certainly no bitterness whatsoever to anybody at Norwich. 
“The club is set up really well to move forward and be successful. They’ve got some really exciting young talent there. 
“I really do wish them all the success and am really looking forward to my next challenge.” Ex-England Manager Roy Hodgson believed to have accidentally left voicemail pre Euros 2016
